name: Avoid Opening Cursor in a loop (EGL)
description: This rule searches for all the artifacts using at least one SQL query inside a loop statement.
output: This report provides the following information: Function full name. Number of Cursors being opened in a Loop
rationale:
Having an SQL query inside a loop is usually the source of performance and scalability problems especially if the number of iterations become very high (for example if it is dependent on the data returned from the database).
This iterative pattern has proved to be very dangerous for application performance and scalability. Database servers handle in a much better set-oriented pattern rather than pure iterative ones.
reference: Standard suggestions based on CAST Quality Model
remediation: Try to reduce the number of opening cursors in the loops.
sample:
[BEGIN of a LOOP (see what all type of loop are possible in Language Reference )]
open CAST_TEST
               with #sql{
  select A,B, C, D
   from CAST1_JOINT T1
    WHERE
       M = :N AND
                  ORDER BY
                    1 ASC
             WITH UR
     }
                into A, B, C, D
                for CAST2_JOINT;
[END of a LOOP (see what all type of loop are possible in Language Reference )]

technicalCriteria.name: ASCPEM-PRF-8 - Control Elements Requiring Significant Resource Element within Control Flow Loop Block
CWE-1050: Excessive Platform Resource Consumption within a Loop

qualityStandards.name: Control Elements Requiring Significant Resource Element within Control Flow Loop Block
qualityStandards.description:
Objective
Detection of occurrences of this pattern helps decrease software resource waste by preventing the repeated consumption of resource due to resource consuming operations found directly or indirectly within loops.

Consequence
Software that is coded so as to execute expensive computations repeatedly (such as in loops) requires excessive computational resources when the usage and data volume grow

qualityStandards.name: Excessive Platform Resource Consumption within a Loop
qualityStandards.description: The software has a loop body or loop condition that contains a control element that directly or indirectly consumes platform resources, e.g. messaging, sessions, locks, or file descriptors.
